result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ramez Hassan

records.addlTxt: FPT for 11/21/22 adjourned to 12/16/22 at 10:00 am at the request of Attorney Olson and no objection from ADA Tombasco.  Confirming email sent to parties.
Final pre-trial on December 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Ramez Hassan not in court. Attorney J. Eric Olson in court for Ramez Hassan. Clerk N. Nobile.
NO RECORD: Parties are requesting to reschedule.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Minutes:  2:33pm.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Daniel Tombasco appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person along w/Atty Eric Olson.  VRC.  State requests an adjournment; defense provided some documents today to the State.  State would like time to review and speak w/complaining witness.  FPT set for 9/22/22 @ 1:45pm.

09:29 AM   State appears by Attorney Alexander Huber. Defendant, Ramez Hassan, appeared with Attorney J. Eric Olson.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Attorney Olson states that the DE objects to Branch 6 hearing this case. For reasons set forth on the record Court will adjourn hearing.  Status conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

02:10 PM  State appears by Attorney Alexander Huber.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Eric Olson.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:  Victim rights compliance. Attorney Olson states the matter is not resolved. Discussion held regarding objection the Branch 6 hearing this matter for trial; DE does object. Court will remove the the JS set for 7/18/22 at 9 am and reschedule a status hearing at that date and time at the parties request.
from the court regarding rotation
Scheduling Order

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: RFS sent to Br 2

Defendant, Ramez Hassan, appeared with Attorney J. Eric Olson.  Attorney Emily K. Gaertner appeared for the Prosecution.     Clerk JT  Minutes:    DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.    DE requests substitution of Br 2; Br 3  assigned. Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. DE motion to modify bond; arguments heard; Victim M.H. addresses the Court; Court denies motion.   Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:50 pm.  Jury selection scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
DE requests substitution of Br 2; Br 3 assigned.
at the request of Atty Olson, PH on 04-19 is rescheduled to 04-26-22 at 10am Intake. DA notified.

123PM    Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Christopher Bub.  Victim: M.H. and N.H.
